bioghist.p: Harry E. Adamson, born in 1949, is an AIDS activist in the Philadelphia area. He is also a person living with AIDS.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of Harry Adamson. Materials include Adamson’s medical, disability, and insurance records, 1996-2003; complete medical chart from Graduate Hospital, 1987-1997; and documentation of Adamson’s participation in the Jonas Salk Remune vaccine study. The papers also include materials related to the donor's work with various HIV/AIDS service organizations, including the AIDS Task Force of Philadelphia (ATFP) and copies of the Philadelphia Community Health Alternatives/AIDS Task Force newsletter, to which Adamson contributed articles. Additional materials include: a 1990 cookbook from the Wissahickon Valley Group, a gay and lesbian social group in northwestern Philadelphia; lunch and dinner menus from Frankie's, an Italian restaurant where Adamson worked ca. 1984; several items of Eastern State Penitentiary memorabilia; Philadelphia Museum of Art posters; a mounted collection of beer labels for the Continental Brewing Co.; and two scrapbooks, one consisting of greeting cards and another of postcards.
